title: [英文文宣] 對政府撤回逃犯修訂條例草案之回應

replies.msg:
The government has been systematically taking away our rights. Nothing will be changed after the formal withdrawal of the extradition bill.

1. The veto power of the pro-democracy camp was taken away by disqualifing legislator with opposite view with the government.

2. With the support of pro-establishment camp, the government pushed through the extradition bill. Despite a million going onto the street and the concern from the lawyers, businesses and international committee, the government did not stop and delay the bill.

3. We went onto the street to stop the bill and protect our freedom. The police stood with the government, abuse their power, breaking their code of practice and posing personal threat to Hong Kong citizens by excessive force in dispersing people, refusing to show their identification, delaying the arrested of their right to legal advise, suspected teaming with triad to beat up people, arbitrary arrests, etc. The list went on and on. The poice beat people indifferently in MTR station on 31 Aug and they failed to reveal the full truth.

4. The government then tried to silence our voice by putting pressure on corporation. Cathy Pacifics fired employees who have posts supporting the movement in social media. White terror spread across the business sector.

5. Now the government is stretching their hands to the young. Police entered campus to interrupt peaceful assembly causing injuires.

Please stand with Hong Kong people for their freedom and rights.
